intro: Prestonia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture. Prestonia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
